definition: (Tw) (slang) a prank, prevalent in Chinese schools and known as "happy corner" in Hong Kong, in which several people carry a victim with his legs spread open, bringing his groin up against a pole or tree trunk
Aruba, island in the Caribbean, a self-governing part of the Netherlands
abbr. for Afghanistan 阿富汗[A1 fu4 han4]
prefix used before monosyllabic names, kinship terms etc to indicate familiarity/used in transliteration/also pr. [a4]
(bound form) crass/stupid/rude/(used to represent the sounds of "ru", "lu" etc in loanwords)
surname Lu/Lu, ancient state of China 魯國|鲁国[Lu3 guo2]/Lu, short name for Shandong 山東|山东[Shan1 dong1]
Ba state during Zhou dynasty (in east of modern Sichuan)/abbr. for east Sichuan or Chongqing/surname Ba/abbr. for Palestine or Palestinian/abbr. for Pakistan

to long for/to wish/to cling to/to stick to/sth that sticks/close to/next to/spread open/informal abbr. for bus 巴士[ba1 shi4]/bar (unit of pressure)/nominalizing suffix on certain nouns, such as 尾巴[wei3 ba5], tail

sentences.english: A tourist in Aruba discovered a jawbone last week.
sentences.chinese: 上週，阿魯巴島的一名遊客發現了一個顎骨。

sentences.english: Rachel: what is it with you and Aruba ?
sentences.chinese: 你和阿魯巴有什麼關係？

sentences.english: Under the Aruban system, any charges would not be filed until later.
sentences.chinese: 在阿魯巴系統，提出任何電荷不會留到以後再說。

sentences.english: Barry: Oh, I, uh- I went to Aruba.
It has already battered the Caribbean islands of Aruba, Curasao and Bonaire.
sentences.chinese: 它已襲擊了位於加勒比海的阿魯巴島。

sentences.english: Aruban authorities have been criticized for their handling of the case.
sentences.chinese: 阿魯巴當局在這個事件的處理上受到了廣泛地批評。

pinyin: Yi1 bi3 li4 ya4 Ban4 dao3

definition: to be scared out of one's wits/to scare stiff
When you enter a country, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
lit. to draw a gourd from the model (idiom)/fig. to copy sth mechanically without attempt at originality
Chechnya, a republic in southwestern Russia/Chechen
